link-text: Evopropinquitous: Things I Learned as a Field Biologist #323
link-description:
evopropinquitous:

One day, you may notice that there is a bite that simply will not heal.

As the days pass, it may become red and begin to weep.

Now itâs a small sore.

Perhaps you dab at it with a bandage throughout the day. Perhaps you smear it with any number of ointments or unguents, maybe applying a poultice…

I sincerely hope nobody I know ever needs this advice – but best to read it, just in case.
